claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

supporting_snippets.quote: For the2024-2025influenzaseasonit is formulatedtocontain135mcgHA per 0.5mLdose, with45mcgHAof eachof thefollowing3influenzavirusstrains:A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok contains 45 mcg of HA per strain (for each of the three influenza virus strains), supporting the claim.
supporting_snippets.context: 12 CLINICAL PHARMACOLOGY 12.1 Mechanism of Action Flublok contains recombinant HAproteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine. ... For the2024-2025influenzaseasonit is formulatedtocontain135mcgHA per 0.5mLdose, with45mcgHAof eachof thefollowing3influenzavirusstrains:A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.

supporting_snippets.quote: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 - 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote introduces the comparator vaccine (IIV3), which is a standard-dose influenza vaccine. This is relevant because it sets up the context for comparing the HA content per strain between Flublok and standard-dose vaccines.
supporting_snippets.context: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 - 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.

supporting_snippets.quote: Data froma randomized, controlled trial demonstrated that children 6 months to less than years of age had diminished hemagglutinin inhibition (HI) responses to Flublok omparedtoaU.S.-licensedinfluenzavaccineapprovedforuseinthispopulation, strongly uggestingthat Flublok wouldnot beeffectiveinchildrenyounger than3years of age(6).
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote references a comparison between Flublok and a U.S.-licensed influenza vaccine, which is typically a standard-dose vaccine containing 15 mcg HA per strain. While it does not state the HA content directly, it is relevant as it establishes the comparator as a standard-dose vaccine.
supporting_snippets.context: Data froma randomized, controlled trial demonstrated that children 6 months to less than years of age had diminished hemagglutinin inhibition (HI) responses to Flublok omparedtoaU.S.-licensedinfluenzavaccineapprovedforuseinthispopulation, strongly uggestingthat Flublok wouldnot beeffectiveinchildrenyounger than3years of age(6).
